sampling module¶

This module contains functions to

  • take samples from a given function and store the samples in a file

  • load saved samples for a given function

mlp_smt_closed.mlp.sampling.load_samples(func_class)¶

Load saved samples of the specified func_class

Parameters

func_class – class for which to load the samples

Returns

List containing x_samples, y_samples, x_train, x_test, y_train, y_test in that order

Return type

(list)

mlp_smt_closed.mlp.sampling.sample(func_class, intervals, sizes, scatter)¶

This function takes sizes[0] * … * sizes[n-1] samples of the function func_class \(\in \mathbb{R}^n \rightarrow \mathbb{R}^n\) within intervals[0] \(\times\) … \(\times\) intervals[n-1]. It also scatters the function values (normally distributed) according to scatter. Then, it divides the samples into training and test samples and stores everything in a file in the folder /samples.

Parameters

  • func_class – function to sample

  • intervals – tuple of intervals for the corresponding dimension

  • sizes – tuple of number of samples to take in the corresponding dimension

  • scatter – standard deviation for normal distribution (choose 0 if no scattering desired)
